programme.title: Manodrome
programme.desc: Concerned about his girlfriend's pregnancy, Ralphie's life spirals when he meets a mysterious family. Writer/director John Trengove's thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Adrien Brody and Odessa Young.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: In early 20th-century Vienna, a man becomes obsessed with the art of conjuring after an encounter with a travelling magician. He decides to leave his homeland to explore the world and perfect his skills. He returns years later a very talented illusionist, and is bent on using his gift to save the love of his life from a marriage to a cruel and vicious prince. Mystery thriller, starring Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti, Jessica Biel and Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.

programme.title: Rob Peace
programme.desc: A young man is torn between his father's shadowed past and his own promising future. Raised by his devoted mother, Rob Peace risks everything he has worked for to free his imprisoned dad. Drama, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, who also adapted Jeff Hobbs' book and directed, with Jay Will, Camila Cabello and Mary J Blige.

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.desc: The story of Frank Abagnale Jr, who found notoriety as a teenager conning and charming his way across America. Posing as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer, Frank was able to fund an extravagant lifestyle while outwitting the FBI at every turn. Fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen and James Brolin.

programme.title: Aisha
programme.desc: While caught up in limbo for years in Ireland's immigration system, Nigerian refugee Aisha Osagie develops a close relationship with former prisoner Conor Healy. However, their friendship soon comes under threat as Aisha's future in Ireland is jeopardised. Drama, starring Letitia Wright, Josh O'Connor and Ruth McCabe.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: A slow-witted man has a series of bizarre adventures, including becoming an American football star, Vietnam veteran, table tennis champion and millionaire businessman - but the love of his life from childhood continues to elude him. Robert Zemeckis's Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Sally Field, Robin Wright and Gary Sinise.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: In early 20th-century Vienna, a man becomes obsessed with the art of conjuring after an encounter with a travelling magician. He decides to leave his homeland to explore the world and perfect his skills. He returns years later a very talented illusionist, and is bent on using his gift to save the love of his life from a marriage to a cruel and vicious prince. Mystery thriller, starring Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti, Jessica Biel and Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: Rob Peace
programme.desc: A young man is torn between his father's shadowed past and his own promising future. Raised by his devoted mother, Rob Peace risks everything he has worked for to free his imprisoned dad. Drama, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, who also adapted Jeff Hobbs' book and directed, with Jay Will, Camila Cabello and Mary J Blige.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: As part of a patrol tasked with clearing stray dogs before the 2008 Olympics, former stunt motorcyclist Lang bonds with a hound. Drama, starring Eddie Peng and Tong Liya. In Chinese with English subtitles.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: A shy, naive lawyer falls foul of a gunslinger while on his way to the backwoods town of Shinbone. His life is saved by a local woman, and he in turn devotes himself to helping the townsfolk while searching for a way to bring the bandit to justice. However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

programme.title: Drift
programme.desc: A young woman escapes her war-torn country to a Greek island, growing close with a tour guide as the pair find hope in each other. Director Anthony Chen's drama, starring Cynthia Erivo and Alia Shawkat.

However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: A soldier falls in love with a student he meets while on two weeks' leave, and he promises to seek her out after completing his tour of duty. However, in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks, he decides to re-enlist in the army, putting their relationship to the test. Romantic drama, with Channing Tatum and Amanda Seyfried.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: The Convert
programme.desc: A preacher's past is revived during a war between two Maori tribes. Co-writer/director Lee Tamahori's action drama, starring Guy Pearce and Tioreore Ngatai-Melbourne.

programme.desc: After moving into a Jehovah's Witness community, lesbian teenager Jamie begins a life-changing love affair with the daughter of a prominent Witness Elder. Drama, starring Anwen O'Driscoll and June Laporte.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview: May 2025
programme.desc: A look ahead to the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: A soldier falls in love with a student he meets while on two weeks' leave, and he promises to seek her out after completing his tour of duty. programme.title: Dunkirk

Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: The Convert
programme.desc: A preacher's past is revived during a war between two Maori tribes. Co-writer/director Lee Tamahori's action drama, starring Guy Pearce and Tioreore Ngatai-Melbourne.(n)

programme.title: Far and Away
programme.desc: Penniless Irish farmer Joseph seeks revenge on the cruel landowner who drove him from his home. However, the landlord's daughter, desperate to escape her family, persuades him to join her in seeking their fortune in America. The pair plan to stake a claim in the Oklahoma gold rush, but instead Joseph is forced to become a bare-knuckle fighter to support them. Romantic drama set in the 1890s, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
programme.desc: Epic fantasy adventure based on the first part of JRR Tolkien's classic trilogy, directed by Peter Jackson, and starring Elijah Wood and Ian McKellen. Frodo, a mild-mannered hobbit, inherits a ring that gives the wearer absolute power. Fearful that Sauron, the dark Lord of Mordor, will steal it, the wizard Gandalf orders Frodo to return the ring to its source where it can be destroyed.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: Western directed by Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jamie Foxx, Samuel L Jackson and Christoph Waltz. After being freed from slavery and trained in the ways of a bounty hunter by Dr King Schultz, Django sets out to free his wife from a vicious plantation owner.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview: May 2025
programme.desc: A look ahead to the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Fight or Flight
programme.desc: A mercenary is assigned a target on a flight, but when rival assassins board the plane, the hunter and the hunted are forced to team up. Action thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Katee Sackhoff and Julian Kostov.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: Supernatural adventure starring Paul Rudd, featuring Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd. The spook-hunting Spengler family joins forces with the original Ghostbusters, whose work is continuing via a secret research lab. When an ancient artefact is discovered and releases an evil force, the team must work together to prevent the dawning of a new Ice Age.

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic sci-fi adventure, starring Henry Thomas and Dee Wallace, and featuring Drew Barrymore. Ten-year-old Elliott has a new friend, but he's from another planet and nobody must know he's here.

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Chris Hemsworth, Brian Tyree Henry, Scarlett Johansson and Keegan-Michael Key.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
programme.desc: Epic fantasy adventure based on the first part of JRR Tolkien's classic trilogy, directed by Peter Jackson, and starring Elijah Wood and Ian McKellen. Frodo, a mild-mannered hobbit, inherits a ring that gives the wearer absolute power. Fearful that Sauron, the dark Lord of Mordor, will steal it, the wizard Gandalf orders Frodo to return the ring to its source where it can be destroyed.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Kenneth Branagh. During the 1940 British evacuation at Dunkirk, three individuals each fight to survive. As young soldier Tommy waits to escape the wartorn beach, a civilian sailor from Weymouth aids in the rescue efforts, while a Spitfire pilot provides air support and gains a singular perspective on the chaos taking place below.

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt. During the Second World War, American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and fellow scientists race against time to develop an atomic bomb before the Nazis. But, during the 1950s Red Scare, his name is dragged through the mud by US officials.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: Western directed by Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jamie Foxx, Samuel L Jackson and Christoph Waltz. After being freed from slavery and trained in the ways of a bounty hunter by Dr King Schultz, Django sets out to free his wife from a vicious plantation owner.

programme.title: Fight or Flight
programme.desc: A mercenary is assigned a target on a flight, but when rival assassins board the plane, the hunter and the hunted are forced to team up. Action thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Katee Sackhoff and Julian Kostov.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Federal agent Aaron Falk returns to his drought-stricken home town after an absence of more than 20 years to attend the funeral of his childhood friend. But his arrival opens up a decades-old wound - the unsolved death of a teenage girl. Crime drama, starring Eric Bana and Genevieve O'Reilly.

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Chris Hemsworth, Brian Tyree Henry, Scarlett Johansson and Keegan-Michael Key.

programme.title: Anyone But You
programme.desc: Bea and Ben enjoy an incredible first date, but attraction quickly burns out and they are delighted to be apart. However, fate compels the duo to reconsider, and they seize the opportunity to attend a lavish wedding in Australia, as a couple. The pair pretend to be deliriously in love during the once-in-a-lifetime trip and keep up appearances in front of other guests. Director Will Gluck's romanti

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Second World War drama directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore and Edward Burns, and featuring Matt Damon. As the horror of the Normandy landings takes its toll, three brothers lie dead. Captain Miller is sent on a special mission in occupied France to bring home the fourth brother, Private Ryan - no matter what the cost.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. Mesmerised by Ally's talent, Jackson invites her to perform with him and she becomes a sensation. The two begin a romantic relationship, but their happiness is threatened as an increasingly washed-up Jackson grapples with substance abuse i

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Musical romantic comedy featuring the music of Abba, and starring Meryl Streep, Colin Firth and Pierce Brosnan. On an idyllic Greek island, young Sophie Sheridan prepares to marry the man of her dreams. But a problem looks set to blight the big day as the bride doesn't know who her father is. So Sophie sends out invitations to three men who might fit the bill, hoping to solve the riddle once her g

programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt. During the Second World War, American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and fellow scientists race against time to develop an atomic bomb before the Nazis. But, during the 1950s Red Scare, his name is dragged through the mud by US officials.

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Second World War drama directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore and Edward Burns, and featuring Matt Damon. As the horror of the Normandy landings takes its toll, three brothers lie dead. Captain Miller is sent on a special mission in occupied France to bring home the fourth brother, Private Ryan - no matter what the cost.

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: A horrifying premonition saves a young man (Bobby Campo) and his friends from death during a racetrack accident, but terrible fates await them nonetheless.

programme.title: Final Destination 5

programme.title: Red Tails
programme.desc: During World War II, the U.S. military forms the first all-black aerial-combat unit, known as the Tuskegee Airmen.

programme.title: Knox Goes Away
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a rapidly evolving form of dementia, a contract killer gets the chance to redeem himself by saving the life of his estranged son.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Queer
programme.desc: Lee, a solitary American in Mexico City, falls for a beautiful, elusive former soldier. Journeying together into the jungle, Lee sees, for the first time, the possibility of an intimate and infinite love.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical
programme.desc: Jenna Hunterson is a waitress and expert pie maker stuck in a small town and a loveless marriage. When a baking contest offers her a chance at escape, Jenna fights to reclaim part of herself.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Michael Keaton) saves dismal Gotham City and gorgeous Vicki Vale (Kim Basinger) from the freaky Joker (Jack Nicholson).

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Michael Keaton) clashes with Catwoman (Michelle Pfeiffer) and saves gloomy Gotham City from the foul Penguin's (Danny DeVito) plot.

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Val Kilmer) woos a criminal psychologist, takes on a sidekick and battles Two-Face (Tommy Lee Jones) and the Riddler (Jim Carrey).

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: Batgirl joins the caped crusaders (George Clooney, Chris O'Donnell) to stop Mr. Freeze (Arnold Schwarzenegger) and Poison Ivy from wreaking revenge upon the world.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: The Batman
programme.desc: Batman ventures into Gotham City's underworld when a sadistic killer leaves behind a trail of cryptic clues. As the scale of the perpetrator's plans become clear, he must bring justice to the abuse of power and corruption that plagues the metropolis.

programme.title: Aquaman
programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren keep a possessed doll locked up in an artifacts room in their house. When the doll awakens the room's evil spirits, it soon becomes a night of terror for the couple's young daughter and her friends.

programme.title: The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren take on one of the most sensational cases of their careers when a young murder suspect claims demonic possession as his defense.

programme.title: X
programme.desc: A group of actors sets out to make an adult film in rural Texas under the noses of their reclusive hosts, but when the elderly couple catches their young guests in the act, the cast finds themselves in a desperate fight for their lives.

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: Trapped on an isolated farm, Pearl must tend to her ailing father under the watch of her mother. Lusting for the glamorous life she's seen in movies, Pearl's temptations and repressions collide.

programme.title: MaXXXine
programme.desc: Aspiring movie star and hustler Maxine Minx finally gets her big break. But as a mysterious killer stalks the starlets of 1980s Hollywood, a trail of blood threatens to reveal her sinister past.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Walter Keane (Christoph Waltz) achieves worldwide fame for pop-art portraits of saucer-eyed waifs, but no one knows that it's his wife, Margaret (Amy Adams), who's the real genius behind the paintbrush.

programme.title: Flow
programme.desc: Cat is a solitary animal, but as its home is devastated by a great flood, he finds refuge on a boat populated by various species, and will have to team up with them despite their differences.

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga: Chapter 1
programme.desc: In 1859 families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas. Meanwhile, a gruff cowboy soon finds himself on the run with a prostitute and a young boy after killing a fellow gunman.
